author: uktraveltips
title: Love this hotel
text:
Initially booked this hotel as a treat for a film buff friend but ended up staying there twice as loved it so much.
It is in a great location (easy to find and well connected on to the metro) stayed twice in April and would certainly return.
Room size was decent both times, this can sometimes be an issue in Paris
They were also very nicely decorated, They are themed after French film artists and are modern, clean, chic and quirky. The hotel even had its own private cinema in the basement with a popcorn machine, we wanted to go but didn't have time
Didn't go for the breakfast option but good food is never too far away, Rue Montoguriel is less than ten minutes walk away heading towards the Marais region and should be checked out, it’s a pedestrianised and is lined with wonderful eateries, including the Stohrer bakery with amazing éclairs!
They offer pastries and tit bits in the hotel from noon to the evening also (this is Paris so bring an appetite!) and it is little pleasant touches such as this that make you feel special.
However the biggest draw are the staff, they are amazingly friendly, always helpful, giving directions and suggestions and spoke a wide range of languages; They are there to look after you.
